```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

## Set-up Data Set

```{r}

library(rvest)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library (lubridate)
library (dplyr)

```



## Input Data

There are 62 counties in New York State.

```{r, echo = FALSE}

#Import NY Covid data (March 1, 2020 to November 22, 2022)

ny_covid_dat <- read.csv("./Raw_Data/NY_COVID_County_Level.csv")

ny_covid_dat #View Data

#Taken from NY Health

#Import NY population data (2022)

ny_pop_dat <- read.csv("./Raw_Data/NY_County_Level_Population_Data.csv")

ny_pop_dat

#Taken from https://www.census.gov/library/stories/state-by-state/new-york-population-change-between-census-decade.html

#Merge data set

combined_dat_ny_covid_pop <- ny_pop_dat %>% 
  left_join(ny_covid_dat, by = "County")

head(combined_dat_ny_covid_pop)
summary(combined_dat_ny_covid_pop)  #View Data

#Export Processed data

getwd() #Check working directory

write.csv2(combined_dat_ny_covid_pop,"./Processed_Data/Combined_NY_COVID_Pop.csv")
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
